borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed development as a whole would by reason of its&nbsp;bulk, mass, size, siting, and design present a disproportionately large addition to the host dwelling, which would appear unsympathetic&nbsp;and unbalancing the symmetry and uniformity of the modest-sized dwellings along the terrace row. As such the proposed development is regarded as unacceptable and contrary to the following development plan policies:</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Paragraphs 126, 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies D1 and&nbsp;D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy&nbsp;CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies SP 2, DMD 1, and DMD 6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).</span></li></ul>
description: Construction of a two-storey side extension, single storey rear extension and front porch. Construction of a rear dormer extension including three roof light to the front. Demolition of existing shed.
